alert.note: Alert for Central Penobscot; Central Piscataquis; Northeast Aroostook; Northern Penobscot; Northern Piscataquis; Northern Somerset; Northwest Aroostook; Southeast Aroostook; Southern Penobscot; Southern Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 11:10AM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...Scattered Strong to Possibly Severe Thunderstorms are Likely From Mid-Afternoon into This Evening... Scattered strong to possibly severe thunderstorms are likely this afternoon, mainly after 2 PM through this evening. Thunderstorms may contain large hail, damaging winds, frequent lightning, and brief torrential downpours. While the threat is low, a brief isolated tornado cannot be ruled out. A line of thunderstorms has already formed west of the area and will move east across the area from mid to late this afternoon into this evening, encountering conditions favorable for strong to severe thunderstorms. Strong thunderstorms can become severe, producing large hail, damaging winds, deadly lightning, and very heavy rainfall. Continue to monitor the National Weather Service or your local media outlet for updates on this developing weather situation, including possible watches and warnings.
